Understate: The claim may understate the government's ability to enforce isolation or quarantine measures for individuals who refuse.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to establish the legality of refusing COVID-19 isolation.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that individuals have the right to resist hospitalization or being taken to quarantine sites without providing clear legal or constitutional basis.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation to the claim, which is that individuals can only refuse COVID-19 isolation if they are able to self-quarantine or self-isolate.
